qoute: Old people love to give good advice to console themselves for no longer being able to set a bad example.
A woman seldom asks advice before she has bought her wedding clothes.
Good advice is something a man gives when he is too old to set a bad example.
A good scare is worth more than good advice.
Advice is seldom welcome; and those who want it the most always like it the least.
Be yourself is about the worst advice you can give to some people.
'Be yourself' is about the worst advice you can give some people.
A politicians willingness to listen to good advice rises in inverse proportion to how badly he thinks he is doing.
A word to the wise ain't necessary - it's the stupid ones that need the advice.
A word to the wise isn't necessary, it is the stupid ones who need all the advice.
Accept good advice gracefully—as long as it doesn't interfere with what you intended to do in the first place.
Advice is like castor oil, easy to give, but dreadful to take.
Old people love to give good advice to console themselves for no longer being able to set a bad example.
A woman seldom asks advice before she has bought her wedding clothes.
Good advice is something a man gives when he is too old to set a bad example.
A good scare is worth more than good advice.
Advice is seldom welcome; and those who want it the most always like it the least.
Be yourself is about the worst advice you can give to some people.
'Be yourself' is about the worst advice you can give some people.
A politicians willingness to listen to good advice rises in inverse proportion to how badly he thinks he is doing.
A word to the wise ain't necessary - it's the stupid ones that need the advice.
A word to the wise isn't necessary, it is the stupid ones who need all the advice.
Accept good advice gracefully—as long as it doesn't interfere with what you intended to do in the first place.
Advice is like castor oil, easy to give, but dreadful to take.
Advice is like snow; the softer it falls the longer it dwells upon, and the deeper it sinks into the mind.
Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.
All of us, at certain moments of our lives, need to take advice and to receive help from other people.
Anybody who thinks talk is cheap should get some legal advice.
Can Love be controll'd by advice?
Death is a very dull, dreary affair, and my advice to you is to have nothing whatever to do with it.
Dying is a very dull, dreary affair. And my advice to you is to have nothing whatever to do with it.
Dying is a very dull, dreary affair. My advice to you is to have nothing whatever to do with it.
Every man, however wise, needs the advice of some sagacious friend in the affairs of life.
Friendship will not stand the strain of very much good advice for very long.
Give help rather than advice.
Good advice is always certain to be ignored, but that's no reason not to give it.
He who can take advice is sometimes superior to him who can give it.
I have found the best way to give advice to your children is to find out what they want and then advise them to do it.
I have yet to hear a man ask for advice on how to combine marriage and a career.
I have yet to hear a man ask for advice on how to combine marriage and a career.
I sometimes give myself admirable advice, but I am incapable of taking it.
If I had to give young writers advice, I would say don't listen to writers talking about writing or themselves.
In giving advice, seek to help, not please, your friend.
In those days he was wiser than he is now - he used frequently to take my advice.
In those days he was wiser than he is now; he used to frequently take my advice.
It is an easy thing for one whose foot is on the outside of calamity to give advice and to rebuke the sufferer.
It is bad advice that cannot be changed.
It is easy to give advice from a port of safety.
It is easy when we are in prosperity to give advice to the afflicted.
It is very difficult to live among people you love and hold back from offering them advice.
It takes a great man to give sound advice tactfully, but a greater to accept it graciously.
Many receive advice, few profit by it.
Many receive advice, only the wise profit from it.
Men give away nothing so liberally as their advice.
Most of us ask for advice when we know the answer but we want a different one.
Most people when they come to you for advice, come to have their own opinions strengthened, not corrected.
My advice is keep your lips away from the spinning things.
My advice to any diplomat who wants to have a good press is to have two or three kids and a dog.
My advice to you concerning applause is this: enjoy it but never quite believe it.
My advice to you is get married: if you find a good wife you’ll be happy; if not, you’ll become a philosopher.
Never give anyone the advice to buy or sell shares, because the most benevolent price of advice can turn out badly.
Never take the advice of someone who has not had your kind of trouble.
Never trust the advice of a man in difficulties.
No one wants advice, only corroboration.
Please give me some good advice in your next letter. I promise not to follow it.
Some people like my advice so much that they frame it upon the wall instead of using it.
The advice of the elders to young men is very apt to be as unreal as a list of the hundred best books.
The advice that is wanted is commonly not welcome and that which is not wanted, evidently an effrontery.
The best advice comes from people who don't give advice.
The best advice on the art of being happy is about as easy to follow as advice to be well when one is sick.
The one thing people are the most liberal with, is their advice.
The only thing to do with good advice is pass it on. It is never any use to oneself.
The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.
The worst men often give the best advice.
The worst men often give the best advice.
There is hardly a man on earth who will take advice unless he is certain that it is positively bad.
To ask for advice is in nine cases out of ten to ask for flattery.
To offer a man unsolicited advice is to presume that he doesn't know what to do or that he can't do it on his own.
To profit from good advice requires more wisdom than to give it.
Wall Street is the only place that people ride to in a Rolls Royce to get advice from those who take the subway.
We all admire the wisdom of people who come to us for advice.
We ask advice but we mean approbation.
We give advice by the bucket, but take it by the grain.
We give advice, but we cannot give the wisdom to profit by it.
We hate those who will not take our advice, and despise them who do.
What exists outside is a man's concern; let no woman give advice; and do no mischief within doors.
Whatever advice you give, be short.
When a man comes to me for advice, I find out the kind of advice he wants, and I give it to him.
When a man wants your advice he generally wants your praise.
When you encounter seemingly good advice that contradicts other seemingly good advice, ignore them both.
When you seek advice, do not withhold any facts from the person whose advice you seek.
Wise men don't need advice. Fools won't take it.
You should read books like you take medicine, by advice, and not by advertisement.
An ordinary man away from home giving advice.
Old men are fond of giving good advice to console themselves for their inability to give bad examples.
